We're going to look at NY NOAA data.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)

library(plotly)

options(
  ggplot2.continuous.colour = "viridis",
  ggplot2.continuous.fill = "viridis"
)

scale_colour_discrete = scale_colour_viridis_d
scale_fill_discrete = scale_fill_viridis_d
```

## Scatterplot

```{r}
data("ny_noaa")

snow_plot =
  ny_noaa %>%
  mutate(
    snow = snow/25.4
  ) %>%
  filter(
    "2008-07-01" < date,  
    date < "2010-07-01",
    snow > "1"
  ) %>%
  select(snow, date) %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y  = snow)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5, aes(color = snow) ) +
   labs(
    title = "Snowfall (in) Comparison of NY Winters in 2009 and 2010 ",
    x = "date",
    y = "snowfall (in)"
  ) + 
    viridis::scale_color_viridis(
    discrete = FALSE
  ) +
  theme_bw()

ggplotly(snow_plot)



 
```

## Boxplot

```{r}
ny_noaa %>%
  mutate(
    snow = round(snow/25.4, digits = 3)
  ) %>%
  filter(
    snow > 1,
    date > "2009-09-01", 
    date < "2010-09-01"
  ) %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  mutate(
    id = fct_reorder(id, snow)
  ) %>%
  plot_ly(
    y = ~snow,
    x = ~id,
    color = ~id,
    type = "box",
    colors = "viridis"
  )
```

## Bar plot

```{r} 
ny_noaa %>%
  count(id) %>%
  mutate(
  id =fct_reorder(id, n)
  ) %>%
  plot_ly(x = ~id, y = ~n, type = "bar", color = ~id, colors = "viridis")
```
